comments.body: this is what encodeURIComponent does on any input
I'm fine with that, it looks like if it's already a string, there's no performance penalty involved.

Also, to anyone who might ask why I didn't put this conditional in the `for` conditional and the `else` block immediately after the end of the `for` loop, it's because there is actually a 2% reduction in the performance increase for the 'fake escaped values' input. The results for the other inputs seem to be largely unaffected though.

I dunno, I didn't do anything with this particular function. However, I remember we switched away from that type of usage (no pun intended) because V8 optimizes `typeof xx === yyy` statements. Before we switched to separate `if` statements, [the code was storing the result of `typeof`](https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/85a92a37ef76059a4733c8e9462ff8da733dfb9e) and that was causing a performance degredation. I suspect `switch(typeof v)` might have the same effect.
